H0.text: Commensalism is a relationship where one species benefits while the other is unaffected.

H1.text: Pollenation is a relationship where one species benefits and the other is unaffected.

H2.text: Mutualism is a relationship in which one species benefits while the other is unaffected.

H3.text: Parasitism is a relationship in which one species benefits while the other species is unaffected.

A4.text: Mutualism describes the ecological interaction between two or more species where each species has a net benefit.

A5.text: parasitism, in which one species benefits at the expense of the other.

A6.text: The Biology of Mutualism: Ecology and Evolution

A8.text: Parasites reduce host fitness by general or specialised pathology, that ranges from parasitic castration to modification of host behaviour.
